meanings.definition: Making a show of being morally superior to others.
meanings.sent1: She always acts sanctimonious, like she's better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The sanctimonious woman looked down on those who didn't share her beliefs.
meanings.sent3: His sanctimonious attitude at the charity event was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The politician's sanctimonious speeches were like a mask hiding his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The sanctimonious teacher's constant preaching grated on the students' nerves.

meanings.definition: Pretending to be morally better than others.
meanings.sent1: Don't be sanctimonious and act like you're perfect.
meanings.sent2: Her sanctimonious behavior made others question her sincerity.
meanings.sent3: His sanctimonious smile didn't fool anyone; we all knew his true nature.
meanings.sent4: The sanctimonious facade she put on crumbled when faced with real challenges.
meanings.sent5: The sanctimonious coworker always tried to one-up everyone in the office.

meanings.sent1: The sanctimonious preacher's words rang hollow to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: Her sanctimonious prayers seemed more for show than genuine belief.
meanings.sent3: The sanctimonious act of the celebrity was seen through by the public.
meanings.sent4: His sanctimonious gestures were merely a cover for his selfish deeds.
meanings.sent5: The sanctimonious display of wealth by the socialite was met with disdain.
